stanza.line: When most I wink then do mine eyes best (a)see(/a)
For all the day they view things (b)unrespected(/b)
But when I sleep in dreams they look on (a)thee(/a)
And darkly bright are bright in dark (b)directed(/b)
Then thou whose shadow shadows doth make (c)bright(/c)
How would thy shadow's form form happy (d)show(/d)
To the clear day with thy much clearer (c)light(/c)
When to unseeing eyes thy shade shines (d)so(/d)
How would (I say) mine eyes be blessed (e)made(/e)
By looking on thee in the living (f)day(/f)
When in dead night thy fair imperfect (e)shade(/e)
Through heavy sleep on sightless eyes doth (f)stay(/f)
All days are nights to see till I see (g)thee(/g)
And nights bright days when dreams do show thee (g)me(/g)
